metadata.titleEn: HiWATER：Dataset of flux observation matrix (No.6 eddy covariance system) of the MUlti-Scale Observation EXperiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces (2012)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：非均匀下垫面地表蒸散发的多尺度观测试验-通量观测矩阵数据集（6号点涡动相关仪）
metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from site No.6 eddy covariance system (EC) in the flux observation matrix from 28 May to 21 September, 2012. The site (100.35970° E, 38.87116° N) was located in a cropland (maize surface) in Yingke irrigation district, which is near Zhangye, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1562.97 m. The EC was installed at a height of 4.6 m; the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3&Li7500A) was 0.15 m.
Raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Edire post-processing software (University of Edinburgh, http://www.geos.ed.ac.uk/abs/research/micromet/EdiRe/), including spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. Moreover, the observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC), which was proposed by Foken and Wichura [1996]: class 1 (level 0: Δst<30 and ITC<30), class 2 (level 1: Δst<100 and ITC<100), and class 3 (level 2: Δst>100 and ITC>100), representing high-, medium-, and low-quality data, respectively. In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.1 m/s. There were 48 records per day; the missing data were replaced with -6999. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m^3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m^3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m^2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m^2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m^2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xlsx format.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2016) (for multi-scale observation experiment or sites information), Xu et al. (2013) (for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2012年5月28日至9月21日的通量观测矩阵中6号点的涡动相关通量观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市盈科灌区农田内，下垫面是玉米。观测点的经纬度是100.35970E, 38.87116N，海拔1562.97m。涡动相关仪架高4.6m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速仪与CO2/H2O分析仪之间的距离是15cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Edire软件后处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Edire软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据每30min内缺失率大于3%的数据；（4）剔除夜间弱湍流的观测数据（u*小于0.1m/s）。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。因仪器漂移等原因引起的可疑数据用红色字体标识。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），稳定度Z/L（无量纲），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为三级（质量标识0:（Δst <30, ITC<30）; 1: （Δst <100, ITC<100）; 其余为2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
多尺度观测试验或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2016)，观测数据处理请参考Xu et al.(2013)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层），并与使用波 Bowen 比率-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行了比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这通常对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，具体是通过观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估计蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括离地5米处的空气温度、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在离地4.5米处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水文遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估算的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估算也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上尺度化是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in collecting multi-scale observational data in eco-hydrological research?
Example.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，收集多尺度观测数据面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge faced in collecting multi-scale observational data in eco-hydrological research is the limited availability of observations that can effectively capture the upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces, as addressed by the HiWATER experiment through a hierarchically nested instrumentation approach.
Example.AnswerCn: 在生态水文研究中，收集多尺度观测数据面临的一个挑战是，有限的观测数据无法有效捕捉异质表面上生态水文过程的上尺度化，HiWATER实验通过分层嵌套的仪器方法对此进行了探讨。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a dataset that supports eco-hydrological process studies in an oasis-desert environment?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个支持绿洲-沙漠环境中生态水文过程研究的数据集示例？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a dataset that supports eco-hydrological process studies in an oasis-desert environment is the multiscale dataset from the HiWATER project, which includes data from eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and airborne remote sensing missions.
Example.AnswerCn: 支持绿洲-沙漠环境生态水文过程研究的数据集的一个例子是HiWATER项目的多尺度数据集，该数据集包括来自涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站和航空遥感任务的数据。

Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区的生态水文研究中，通量观测矩阵的具体属性或特征是什么？

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What challenges are encountered in the separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures for accurate evapotranspiration estimation?

Feature Specification.AnswerEn: errors from image classification, overestimation of canopy temperature, uncertainties from atmospheric upwelling radiation, uncertainties from transmittance
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 图像分类错误、冠层温度高估、大气上行辐射的不确定性、透射率的不确定性

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'quality control' in the context of generating datasets from eco-hydrological experiments?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文实验中生成数据集时，“质量控制”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: Quality control in the context of generating datasets from eco-hydrological experiments involves a thorough process of ensuring data accuracy and reliability. This includes sensor calibration, careful data collection, meticulous data processing, and the generation of datasets that are rigorously checked for quality before being made available for research and analysis.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在生态水文实验中生成数据集的质量控制涉及确保数据准确性和可靠性的全面过程。这包括传感器校准、仔细的数据收集、细致的数据处理，以及在数据集可供研究和分析之前进行严格质量检查的生成过程。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the data collection method utilizing eddy covariance systems compare to the use of high-precision thermal infrared cameras in estimating evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 利用涡度协方差系统的数据收集方法与使用高精度热红外相机在异质景观中估算蒸散发的比较如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The eddy covariance (EC) system provides direct measurements of turbulent fluxes like sensible and latent heat at high frequencies (10 Hz), and is used for energy balance closure. High-precision thermal infrared cameras, on the other hand, measure soil and canopy component temperatures for input into models like TSEB to estimate E, T, and ET. The EC system is limited by energy balance closure issues and uncertainties in H estimation, while thermal cameras require accurate image classification and conversion to radiometric temperatures.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差（EC）系统以高频率（10 Hz）直接测量湍流通量，如显热和潜热，并用于能量平衡闭合。高精度热红外相机则测量土壤和冠层组件的温度，以便输入到模型如TSEB中，以估算蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸发蒸散（ET）。EC系统受到能量平衡闭合问题和H估算不确定性的限制，而热相机则需要准确的图像分类和转换为辐射温度。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the combination of stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques with eddy covariance measurements provide a more comprehensive understanding of evapotranspiration patterns in a heterogeneous landscape?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度协方差测量的结合如何提供对异质景观中蒸散发模式更全面的理解？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The combination of stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques with eddy covariance measurements allows for the validation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration estimates by providing observed ratios of these components. This approach helps overcome challenges in measuring individual components of evapotranspiration, especially in complex, heterogeneous landscapes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度协方差测量的结合，能够通过提供这些组分的观测比率来验证蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发的估算。这种方法有助于克服在复杂异质景观中测量蒸散发各个组分的挑战。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What methodological challenges might arise when using high-resolution thermal cameras to estimate soil and canopy component temperatures, and how can these challenges impact the accuracy of evapotranspiration models?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪估计土壤和冠层成分温度时可能出现哪些方法论挑战，这些挑战如何影响蒸散发模型的准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Methodological challenges when using high-resolution thermal cameras include image classification errors, which can lead to incorrect soil and canopy temperature estimates. These errors impact the accuracy of models like the TSEB model by affecting the calculated component temperatures, ultimately influencing the estimation of latent heat fluxes and evapotranspiration rates.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪时的方法论挑战包括图像分类错误，这可能导致土壤和冠层温度估计不准确。这些错误会影响像TSEB模型这样的模型的准确性，进而影响计算的组成温度，最终影响潜热通量和蒸散发率的估算。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways could multiscale datasets contribute to overcoming the challenges of observing eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes, and what types of instruments are essential for capturing these processes effectively?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 多尺度数据集如何有助于克服在异质景观中观察生态水文过程的挑战，以及哪些类型的仪器对于有效捕捉这些过程是必不可少的？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Multiscale datasets can address the challenge of observing eco-hydrological processes by providing comprehensive data across different scales through hierarchically nested instrumentation. Essential instruments include eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing tools like LiDAR and thermal imagers, which collectively capture detailed eco-hydrological interactions in diverse landscapes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 多尺度数据集可以通过分层嵌套的仪器提供不同尺度的综合数据，从而解决观察生态水文过程的挑战。重要的仪器包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站以及遥感工具如激光雷达和热成像仪，这些工具共同捕捉不同景观中详细的生态水文相互作用。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to incomplete energy balance closure in eddy covariance flux measurements, errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures, and a strong advective environment affecting the TSEB model performance. The uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference also plays a significant role in influencing the model's accuracy.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的，这主要是由于涡度协方差通量测量中能量平衡闭合不完全、表层土壤和植被组分温度确定的误差，以及强平流环境对TSEB模型性能的影响。表面与空气温度差的不确定性也在很大程度上影响了模型的准确性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a need for multiscale observations in eco-hydrological process studies?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在生态水文过程研究中，为什么需要多尺度观测？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations are needed in eco-hydrological process studies because upscaling these processes on heterogeneous surfaces is challenging due to limited availability of multiscale data. HiWATER addresses this challenge by using hierarchically nested instrumentation to capture multiscale and multidisciplinary data, allowing for a better understanding of oasis-desert interactions and eco-hydrological dynamics.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 生态水文过程研究需要多尺度观测，因为在异质表面上对这些过程进行尺度放大是具有挑战性的，主要是由于多尺度数据的有限可用性。HiWATER通过使用分层嵌套的仪器来捕获多尺度和多学科的数据，从而更好地理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用和生态水文动态。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the main causes of errors in estimating component temperatures from thermal images in agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在农业区域中，从热成像估计组件温度的主要误差原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in estimating component temperatures from thermal images in agricultural areas are caused by image classification errors, particularly when classifying vegetation and soil pixels. These errors vary with vegetation abundance and lead to overestimation of canopy temperatures. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, as well as uncertainties in estimating incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy, contribute to errors in temperature estimation.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在农业地区，从热成像中估计组件温度的错误是由于图像分类错误引起的，特别是在分类植被和土壤像素时。这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化，导致对冠层温度的过高估计。此外，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率，以及在估计通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率时的不确定性，也会导致温度估计的错误。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of implementing multiscale observation techniques on the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimation in heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中实施多尺度观测技术对蒸散发估算准确性的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing multiscale observation techniques can significantly improve the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimation in heterogeneous landscapes by providing detailed and diverse data that account for the variability in surface conditions. This approach, as seen in the HiWATER experiment, allows for a more comprehensive understanding of eco-hydrological processes by capturing data at different scales, from local to regional, thereby enhancing the reliability of models like the TSEB model in estimating evaporation and transpiration accurately.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 实施多尺度观测技术可以显著提高异质景观中蒸散发估算的准确性，因为它提供了详细和多样化的数据，考虑了地表条件的变化。这种方法在HiWATER实验中得到了体现，通过在从局部到区域的不同尺度捕获数据，从而对生态水文过程有更全面的理解，增强了像TSEB模型这样的模型在准确估算蒸发和蒸腾方面的可靠性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What specific steps are involved in preprocessing the eddy covariance data to ensure its quality and reliability for flux estimation in heterogeneous landscapes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中预处理涡度协方差数据以确保其质量和可靠性用于通量估算涉及哪些具体步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The preprocessing of eddy covariance data involves several steps including outlier removal, delay time correction, coordinate rotation (double coordinate rotation), frequency response correction, ultrasonic virtual temperature correction, and density (WPL) correction. Additionally, quality evaluation of flux values is conducted based on atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics. Data is further filtered by removing erroneous instrument data, data within 1 hour before and after rainfall, data with more than 3% missing in 30-minute intervals, and weak turbulence data at night (u* less than 0.1 m/s).
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差数据的预处理涉及多个步骤，包括异常值去除、延迟时间校正、坐标旋转（双坐标旋转）、频率响应校正、超声波虚温度校正和密度（WPL）校正。此外，基于大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征对通量值进行质量评估。数据进一步过滤，去除错误的仪器数据、降雨前后1小时内的数据、30分钟间隔内缺失超过3%的数据，以及夜间湍流较弱（u*小于0.1 m/s）的数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodologies are employed to partition evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration using remote sensing and ground-based observations?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 使用遥感和地面观测将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾的分区方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The partitioning of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration is achieved by integrating ground-based soil and canopy component temperatures with a high-resolution thermal camera into a two-source energy balance (TSEB) model. The Craig–Gordon model is applied to partition ET using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes. The soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes are estimated with the TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes are calculated through energy balance equations. The component temperatures are derived from thermal images, classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method, and validated against radiometric temperatures.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 通过将地面土壤和冠层组件温度与高分辨率热像仪集成到双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型中，实现了蒸散发的分区为蒸发和蒸腾。使用稳定的氧和氢同位素应用Craig-Gordon模型来分区ET。土壤和冠层的感热通量通过TSEB模型进行估算，其潜热通量通过能量平衡方程计算。组件温度通过热成像获得，使用最大似然法将其分类为土壤和冠层像素，并与辐射温度进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What instrumentation and observation techniques enable the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data over heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些仪器和观测技术能够在异质景观上收集多尺度生态水文数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The instrumentation and observation techniques include a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 仪器和观测技术包括涡度协方差塔、宽孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的地面测量植被动态和光合作用过程。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do ground-based measurements enable the accurate separation of soil and canopy component temperatures in a highly advective agricultural area?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 地面测量如何在高度对流的农业区域中准确分离土壤和冠层成分温度？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Ground-based measurements enable accurate separation by using soil and canopy component temperatures calculated from images obtained with a thermal camera. These temperatures are validated against surface radiometric temperatures calculated from long-wave radiation observations, ensuring reliable estimates of latent heat fluxes and separation of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration components.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 地面测量通过使用热像仪获取的图像计算土壤和冠层组分温度，从而实现准确分离。这些温度与通过长波辐射观测计算的表面辐射温度进行验证，确保潜热通量的可靠估计，并将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾组分。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions are necessary for the effective use of a two-source energy balance model in estimating evapotranspiration over vegetated land?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 有效使用双源能量平衡模型估算植被土地上的蒸散发所需的条件是什么？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Effective use of a two-source energy balance model requires accurate measurements of soil and canopy component temperatures, reliable separation of these components, and validation with observed ratios of evaporation and transpiration using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes along with eddy covariance system measurements. The model's performance is influenced by the strong advective environment and potential errors in surface–air temperature differences.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 有效使用双源能量平衡模型需要准确测量土壤和冠层组分的温度，可靠地分离这些组分，并使用稳定氧和氢同位素以及涡度协方差系统测量进行蒸发和蒸腾的观测比率验证。模型的性能受到强烈的平流环境和表面-空气温度差异潜在误差的影响。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective are the current data collection methods for capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 当前的数据收集方法在捕捉异质景观中的多尺度生态水文过程方面的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The current data collection methods, as described in the field above, utilize a hierarchical and nested scale approach with a combination of eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and airborne remote sensing technologies. This setup is designed to address the challenge of capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes, although the effectiveness can be hindered by poor availability of multiscale observations.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的数据收集方法，如上所述，采用了分层和嵌套的尺度方法，结合了涡度协方差塔、自动气象站和航空遥感技术。该设置旨在应对捕捉多尺度生态水文过程的挑战，尽管其有效性可能受到多尺度观测可用性差的影响。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in using thermal infrared cameras for soil and canopy temperature measurements in agricultural areas?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在农业区域使用热红外相机进行土壤和树冠温度测量的潜在挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The challenges include image classification errors that may arise from vegetation abundance, leading to misclassification of soil pixels as vegetation pixels. This results in overestimation of canopy temperature. There are also uncertainties related to atmospheric upwelling radiation, transmittance, and the incoming short- and long-wave radiation through the canopy, which can affect the accuracy of estimated temperatures.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 挑战包括由于植被丰度导致的图像分类错误，这可能导致土壤像素被误分类为植被像素。这会导致对冠层温度的高估。此外，与大气上行辐射、透射率以及通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射相关的不确定性，也会影响温度估计的准确性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Analyze the challenges faced in scaling eco-hydrological observations across heterogeneous surfaces and the methodologies used to address these challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析在异质表面上扩展生态水文观测所面临的挑战以及用于解决这些挑战的方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The primary challenge in scaling eco-hydrological observations is the limited availability of multiscale data. To address this, HiWATER implemented instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, including a sparse network to capture oasis-desert interactions and a superstation within the oasis. Multiple EC towers and automatic meteorological stations were established across various landscapes. Intensive observation periods and remote sensing missions, using LiDAR and other technologies, were conducted to obtain comprehensive multiscale data. These measures facilitated the examination of eco-hydrological processes across scales.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在扩展生态水文观测方面，主要挑战是多尺度数据的有限可用性。为了解决这个问题，HiWATER在分层嵌套的尺度上实施了仪器布置，包括一个稀疏网络，以捕捉绿洲-沙漠相互作用，以及在绿洲内的超级站。多个EC塔和自动气象站在不同的景观中建立。进行了密集观测期和遥感任务，使用LiDAR等技术，以获取全面的多尺度数据。这些措施促进了跨尺度生态水文过程的研究。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please discuss the strategies used to ensure the quality control of datasets obtained from multiscale eco-hydrological experiments.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请讨论确保从多尺度生态水文实验中获得的数据集质量控制的策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Quality control strategies for datasets from multiscale eco-hydrological experiments include thorough sensor calibration, meticulous data collection, and rigorous data processing. Each dataset undergoes quality checks to ensure integrity and accuracy. Observations are collected through a combination of ground-based instrumentation, such as eddy covariance towers and meteorological stations, and airborne remote sensing, using technologies like LiDAR and thermal imaging. The datasets are then made freely available, ensuring transparency and accessibility for further research.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 多尺度生态水文实验的数据集的质量控制策略包括彻底的传感器校准、细致的数据收集和严格的数据处理。每个数据集都经过质量检查，以确保其完整性和准确性。观测数据通过地面仪器（如涡度协方差塔和气象站）和空中遥感（使用激光雷达和热成像等技术）相结合的方式收集。数据集随后被免费提供，确保透明性和可获取性，以便进一步研究。
